personalInfo.family: Wife Evangelina; Romina (20/12/1990), Leonardo (22/06/1997) and Victoria (5/6/2012)

tourBios.curYrHigh: Posted four rounds of 70 or better to finish T3 at the PGA TOUR Latinoamérica Q-School in Buenos Aires, Argentina in January.
tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Had three top-25s and seven cuts made in 16 starts to finish the PGA TOUR Latinoamérica season ranked 84th on the Order of Merit. His best finish was T16 at the Personal Classic in Argentina in November.

2014: Had his best season on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica, collecting a runner-up finish, three top-10s, five top-25s and 11 cuts made in 14 starts to rank 21st on the Order of Merit… His solo second at the rain-shortened Personal Classic, where he shot 65-62 to hold the 36-hole lead before finishing seven shots behind Fabián Gómez, was a PGA TOUR Latinoamérica career best for him… His other top-finish was T5 at the Lexu Peru Open.

2013: Had two top-10s and six cuts made in 10 starts on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica to finish the season ranked 46th on the Order of Merit… Had three top-15s on his last six starts of the season, starting with a season best T5 at the Aberto do Brasil in October

2012: Shot 66-69 on the weekend on his way to a PGA TOUR Latinoamérica season best solo fourth at the Puerto Rico Classic. That was his only top-25 in a season in which he made only three cuts in ten starts to finish 59th on the Order of Merit.

2011: Had four top-10s in 15 starts on the Tour de las Américas. By finishing 25th on the Order of Merit he went on to secure exempt status for the inaugural season of PGA TOUR Latinoamérica… His best TLA finishes were third at the 80th Abierto del Centro in Cordoba, Argentina and fourth at the VI Abierto Hacienda Chicureo in Chile. 

2010: Defeated Venezuela's Wolmer Murillo in a three-hole playoff to win the 84th Abierto de Chile for his first career victory on the Tour de las Americas… Also won the Argentine Tour's Abierto de Misiones.

2007: Shared runner-up honors at the Kai Fieberg Costa Rica Open, an event co-sanctioned by the Tour de las Americas and the European Challenge Tour.

2005: Won the Argentine Tour's Gran Premio Lomas.

2001: Lost a five-man playoff to Marco Ruiz for the title of the Tour de las Américas' Abierto del Litoral in Rosario, Argentina.

1998: Won his first title as a professional on the Argentine Tour in Rio Cuarto, Cordoba.
tourBios.personal: Picked up the game at the age of ten while caddying at the Jockey Club de Rafaela in his hometown of Rafaela, Santa Fe… His favorite golf course is the historic links course at the Mar del Plata Golf Club in Argentina… Favorite professional team is Boca Juniors.
tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Finished 2-11 at 2016 Q-School (exempt to midseason reshuffle)
